DataElement.preferredName: Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumor AJCC Edition 8 Pathologic Distant Metastasis M Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the distant metastasis for pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor based on pathologic findings using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumor Pathologic M Category
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A low or intermediate grade well differentiated tumor with neuroendocrine differentiation that arises from the pancreas.  According to the presence or absence of clinical syndromes that result from hormone hypersecretion, pancreatic neuroendocrine tumors are classified either as functional or nonfunctional._Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology._One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A low or intermediate grade well differentiated tumor with neuroendocrine differentiation that arises from the pancreas

Concepts.definition: A well differentiated, low, intermediate, or high grade neoplasm with neuroendocrine differentiation that arises from the pancreas.  According to the presence or absence of clinical syndromes that result from hormone hypersecretion, pancreatic neuroendocrine tumors are classified either as functional or nonfunctional.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pathologic; caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  M refers to the presence of metastasis.

Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 5-3-19 released; tmt. 3/21/19 curated for AJCC ed. 8 content; tmt.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumor American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 Pathologic M Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of a pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases._A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology._One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumor cM0 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumor cM0 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor without evidence of distant metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumor cM0 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor without evidence of distant metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumor cM1 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumor cM1 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor with distant metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumor cM1 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor with distant metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumor pM1 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumor pM1 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor with distant metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumor pM1 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor with distant metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumor pM1c TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumor pM1c TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor with both hepatic and extrahepatic metastases. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumor pM1c TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor with both hepatic and extrahepatic metastases. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumor pM1b TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumor pM1b TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor with metastasis in at least one extrahepatic site (e.g., lung, ovary, nonregional lymph node, peritoneum, bone). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumor pM1b TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor with metastasis in at least one extrahepatic site (e.g., lung, ovary, nonregional lymph node, peritoneum, bone). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumor pM1a TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumor pM1a TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor with metastasis confined to liver. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumor pM1a TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor with metastasis confined to liver. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)
